title: Alcatel-Lucent
summary: Alcatel–Lucent S.A. (French pronunciation: ​[alkatɛl lysɛnt]) was a French–American global telecommunications equipment company, headquartered in Boulogne-Billancourt, France. It was formed in 2006 by the merger of France-based Alcatel and U.S.-based Lucent, the latter being a successor of AT&T's Western Electric and Bell Labs.[1]
